api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

component_logic.responsibility: Initializes and configures the HTTP server framework with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and return a configured FastAPI application instance
Register all route handlers with the FastAPI application
Start the HTTP server on specified host and port

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ framework for HTTP server. Initialize app with title='Hello World API' and version='1.0.0'. Configure CORS if needed (allow all origins for development). Use uvicorn as ASGI server with workers=1 for single-process deployment. Default host='0.0.0.0' and port=8000. Implement graceful shutdown handling.

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns formatted response

interfaces.description: Handle GET /hello request and return greeting message
Format message into response dictionary structure

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement as FastAPI route handler decorated with @app.get('/hello'). Return dictionary with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. Use FastAPI's automatic JSON serialization. Handler should be synchronous (no async needed for simple operation). Response status code defaults to 200 OK. No request body or query parameters required.

component_logic.responsibility: Formats HTTP responses with proper status codes and error handling

interfaces.description: Format successful response with status code 200
Format error response with appropriate status code
Handle unexpected exceptions and return 500 error response

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI JSONResponse for explicit response control. Success responses return status_code=200 with data payload. Error responses include error_code and message fields. Implement exception handler middleware to catch unhandled exceptions and return 500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR with code='INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR'. Log all errors with Python logging module at ERROR level. Ensure all responses are valid JSON.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify HTTP server framework is properly initialized and configured
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework component must initialize FastAPI app with title and version. Routes must be registered before server starts. App instance must be accessible to route handlers.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify route handler is correctly registered with HTTP framework
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler.hello() must be decorated with @app.get('/hello'). Method must be registered with HTTPServerFramework.configure_routes(). Endpoint path must exactly match '/hello' (case-sensitive).

design_review_checklist.description: Verify all exceptions are caught and formatted as JSON responses
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: ResponseFormatter must implement exception handler middleware. Unhandled exceptions must return 500 status with error_code='INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR'. All error responses must be valid JSON with message field.
HelloRouteHandler must return plain dictionary (not custom object). FastAPI automatic JSON serialization must be used. No manual JSON encoding required.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format matches API contract specification
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must contain exactly one key 'message' with value 'Hello World'. Response must be valid JSON. Status code must be 200 for successful requests.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component dependencies are correctly structured
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler depends on HTTPServerFramework. ResponseFormatter has no dependencies. No circular dependencies exist. Dependency injection must be explicit.

architecture_overview: Simple 3-tier architecture for HTTP API: HTTPServerFramework initializes and configures the FastAPI application with routing infrastructure (SU-001). HelloRouteHandler implements the GET /hello endpoint that returns a greeting message (SU-002). ResponseFormatter handles response serialization and error formatting with proper HTTP status codes (SU-003). The framework automatically serializes Python dictionaries to JSON. Exception handling middleware catches all unhandled exceptions and returns appropriate error responses. No database, authentication, or complex business logic required.
assumptions: Server runs on localhost:8000 by default (host=0.0.0.0, port=8000)
No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
No database or persistent storage needed
HTTP/1.1 protocol is sufficient (no HTTP/2 required)
No rate limiting or request throttling needed
CORS is not required or can be configured at infrastructure level
Synchronous request handling is acceptable (no async/await needed)
All exceptions should return 500 status code with error response
